definition: to pat/to clap/to slap/to swat/to take (a photo)/to shoot (a film)/racket (sports)/beat (music)
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: Whether it is animals or ancient figures will let you clap wow .
sentences.chinese: 无论是动物还是古代人物都会让你拍手叫绝。

sentences.english: Teacher points the words and students read after it.
sentences.chinese: 师用拍手的方式，让学生跟读几个单词的规范语音。

sentences.english: Then he would stand up and clapped his hands and said that he would stop playing to continue his work.
sentences.chinese: 然后爬起来，拍拍手说，不玩了，又继续干活儿去了。

sentences.english: The delicious food of all over the world there also lets tourists get their eyes wide open.
sentences.chinese: 中外美食更是令人大开眼界，拍手叫绝。

sentences.english: The little monk danced and clapped with happiness.
The teacher clapped her hands to make the students quiet.
sentences.chinese: 老师拍拍手使学生们安静下来。

sentences.english: We applauded and cheered for a goal scored by our own team.
sentences.chinese: 我们为自己的队踢进一球拍手叫好。

sentences.english: The choir claps and taps to accent the swing of the music.
sentences.chinese: 歌唱队既拍手又跺脚，以加重音乐的节奏。

sentences.english: People laughed and clapped their hands as the horses and the lion tamer performed.
sentences.chinese: 当驯马和驯狮者表演时，人们笑着拍手鼓掌。

sentences.english: The little drow laughed and clapped her hands.
Experts have celebrated the power of brainstorming and idea-generation techniques.
sentences.chinese: 专家们为脑力激荡和创意产生机制的威力拍手叫好。

sentences.english: With time elapsing, the flaps collapse up on his clapper' s lap.
sentences.chinese: 随着时光流逝，袋盖在拍手者的膝上堆叠起来。

sentences.english: I don't think many people will be sorry to see the back of him.
sentences.chinese: 我想，许多人看见他离开这儿都会拍手称快的。

sentences.english: For all those reasons, Gates should be applauded for his candor.
sentences.chinese: 出于所有这些原因，盖茨应该为他的坦率拍手叫好。

sentences.english: First of all, stand " clapper " position to illustrate the "clap. "
sentences.chinese: 首先，站在“拍手者”的立场来说明一下“拍手”。

sentences.english: First of all, stand " clapper " position to illustrate the "clap. "
sentences.chinese: 首先，站在“拍手者”的立场来说明一下“拍手”。

definition: to laugh heartily/to burst into loud laughter
to clap one's hands/to clap each other's hands/high five
brows raised in delight, eyes laughing (idiom); beaming with joy/all smiles
joyfully satisfied/to be immensely proud of oneself/proudly/an air of complacency
to agree/to go along with/to echo (what sb says)

combined ideogram (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书[liu4 shu1] of forming Chinese characters)/Chinese character that combines the meanings of existing elements/also known as joint ideogram or associative compounds/to comprehend without being told explicitly/to cotton on/knowing (smile, glance etc)
to wave/to brandish/to command/to conduct/to scatter/to disperse
